page.title: 03SITE OF KELHAM
page.content: The site of the small ,attractive village of Kelham is in the Trent Valley.It nestles in the curve of the River Trent and is adjacent to Kelham Bridge,which is often subject to traffic "jams" due to its narrowness. Land is mostly flat,well cultivated and rises slightly where Kelham Hall is situated. The population of 114 comes mainly from council houses,private homes of a more modest nature,executive dwellings and farm worker cottages.A work force commutes to Kelham Hall.Many houses have been renovated but there has been little re-building in recent years. Thus the population tends to be predominately older.A building programme is needed. Essential village meeting points are the Post Office,Kelham Hall and the Public House.
